tool.name: qiime2 emperor biplot
tool.description: Visualize and Interact with Principal Coordinates Analysis Biplot

param.name: biplot
param.label: biplot: PCoAResults % Properties('biplot')
param.help: [required] The principal coordinates matrix to be plotted.

repeat.name: feature_metadata
repeat.help: [optional] The feature metadata (useful to manipulate the arrows in the plot).
repeat.title: feature_metadata: Metadata

param.name: ignore_missing_samples
param.label: ignore_missing_samples: Bool
param.help: [default: No] This will suppress the error raised when the coordinates matrix contains samples that are not present in the metadata. Samples without metadata are included by setting all metadata values to: "This sample has no metadata". This flag is only applied if at least one sample is present in both the coordinates matrix and the metadata.

param.name: invert
param.label: invert: Bool
param.help: [default: No] If specified, the point and arrow coordinates will be swapped.

param.name: number_of_features
param.label: number_of_features: Int % Range(1, None)
param.help: [default: 5] The number of most important features (arrows) to display in the ordination. “Importance” is calculated for each feature based on the vector’s magnitude (euclidean distance from origin).

tool.help:
QIIME 2: emperor biplot ======================= Visualize and Interact with Principal Coordinates Analysis Biplot
Outputs: -------- :visualization.qzv: <no description>
|
Description: ------------ Generates an interactive ordination biplot where the user can visually integrate sample and feature metadata. Vectors representing the n most important features are then plotted in the emperor visualization (5 largest, by default).
|
